SkirmishAI/Transfer control of Team to or from Skirmish AI.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Ensure you have needed components of Skirmish AI turned on.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Transfer control of Unit to or from Skirmish AI.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Ensure you have needed components of Skirmish AI turned on.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Transfer control of all player's units to or from Skirmish AI -- Enable Skirmish AI.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Transfers control of all players objects to or from the Skirmish AI, it also starts the AI timers and opening moves(turns Skirmish AI On, if transferring to the Skirmish AI). Ensure you have needed components of Skirmish AI turned on in the player list.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Transfer ownership of all player's units to or from Skirmish AI -- Don't Enable Skirmish AI.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Transfers control of all a players units to or from the Skirmish AI, note it does not start its timers or opening moves (doesn't turn the AI on if transferring to the AI).

UIString.value: without starting opening moves and timers.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Start AI Opening moves and timers(Turn on the Skirmish AI).
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Units that have been transferred to the SkirmishAI will now start executing their opening moves and timers. Ensure you have needed components of Skirmish AI turned on in the player list.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Enemy Target Control/Set enemy player priority
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: AI's target heuristics will always choose a higher-priority enemy's stuff over a lower-priority enemy's stuff, if possible. Priority of zero means the target heuristics will never consider that enemy.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Enemy Target Control/Clear enemy player priority
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: AI's target heuristics will will never target this enemy's objects.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Enemy Target Control/Set all enemy players' priority
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: AI's target heuristics will always choose a higher-priority enemy's stuff over a lower-priority enemy's stuff, if possible. Priority of zero means the target heuristics will never consider that enemy.

UIString.value: : Give all enemy players a target priority of

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Enemy Target Control/Clear all enemy players' priority
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: AI's target heuristics will not target any enemies until 'Set enemy player priority' is called

UIString.value: : Does not target any enemy player.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Enemy Target Control/Use automatic enemy player prioritization scheme
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: AI automatically prioritizes enemy players using the given scheme

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Enemy Target Control/Use default automatic enemy player prioritization scheme
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: AI automatically prioritizes enemy players using the default scheme for the AI's difficulty and personality

UIString.value: : Choose enemy players automatically using default prioritization scheme

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Build Control/Consider specific enemy when deciding what to build
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: AI considers the units owned by the given enemy when evaluating BEST_UNIT_EXPECTED, BEST_UNIT_WEIGHTED, WORST_UNIT, FACTORY, and base defense build heuristics.

UIString.value: 's units when deciding what the best or worst unit to build is.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Build Control/Don't consider specific enemy when deciding what to build
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: AI does not consider the units owned by the given enemy when evaluating BEST_UNIT_EXPECTED, BEST_UNIT_WEIGHTED, WORST_UNIT, FACTORY, and base defense build heuristics.

UIString.value: 's units when deciding what the best or worst unit to build is.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Build Control/Consider all enemies when deciding what to build
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: AI considers the units owned by the all its enemies equally when evaluating BEST_UNIT_EXPECTED, BEST_UNIT_WEIGHTED, WORST_UNIT, FACTORY, and base defense build heuristics.

UIString.value: : Considers all enemies' units when deciding what the best or worst unit to build is.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Build Control/Don't consider any enemies when deciding what to build
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: AI does not consider the units owned by the any its enemies when evaluating BEST_UNIT_EXPECTED, BEST_UNIT_WEIGHTED, WORST_UNIT, FACTORY, and base defense build heuristics.

UIString.value: : Do not consider any enemies' units when deciding what the best or worst unit to build is.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Interface/Info Box/Show Info Box
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Displays an info box over the top of the named object. Optionally the 4th parameter takes a string of an image id to display an image. If the image is found it will display this image in the info box. Note that a time of 0 will result in a never ending info box that will only be removed when the script Remove Info Box is used on the unit.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Interface/Info Box/Remove Info Box
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Removes.....wait for it.... The info box on this unit.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Player/Money/Toggle allied resource sharing on-off.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Toggles resource sharing for this player on/off. When on this player will share all gathered resources with it's allies.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Team/Move/Set team to follow a waypoint path starting at waypoint.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Please note that this script will allow you to specify a Waypoint to start on but doesn't check if that Waypoint is part of the path you specified. Please be careful with this.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Object Type/Move/Named object follow a waypoint path starting at waypoint.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Please note that this script will allow you to specify a Waypoint to start on but doesn't check if that Waypoint is part of the path you specified. Please be careful with this.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Object Type/Attack/Named Object force attack a named object.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Sets a named object to force attack another named object. Useful to make friendly units attack each other.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Object Type/Attack/Named Object force attack a waypoint.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Sets a named object to force attack a waypoint. Useful to make a unit bombard the ground at a particular location.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Campaign/Create campaign auto save checkpoint.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Create a new auto save checkpoint with a description. This script will work both in single player with an AI buddy and in Co-Op.

UIString.value: Create auto save checkpoint with description:

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Interface/Show unit intro
Player/Retreat/Set all units on player to flee off map.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Units that need to flee are required to have a RunOffMapBehavior in their object definition for the unit to be affected. Any units without it will ignore this script. The RunOffMapBehavior has two modes of operation one is to have the unit run to a waypoint specified in the behavior or go 1000 units in the direction the unit is currently facing, if it can't path to either point the unit will kill itself. Please be careful with this as some units may not be able to go to whatever exit point and will kill themselves at their current location.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Interface/Toggle CoOp AI interface.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Toggle the CoOp AI's interface on and off. It defaults to on.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Toggle SkirmishAI On-Off.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: The SkirmishAI is on by default. Toggling it off will shut it down completely. This is different than the scripts which transfer assets between the default player team and the default skirmish team. It is only necessary to use this for performance reasons.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Beacon/Spawn an AI Beacon at a waypoint.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Spawns an AI Beacon of a given type at a waypoint and informs the AI of it's placement.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: SkirmishAI/Beacon/Spawn an AI Beacon on a named object
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Spawns an AI Beacon of a given type and attaches it to a named object.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Interface/Radar/Toggle the Radar on or off
Scripting/Evaluation/Evaluate Script
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: ONLY USE IN A SEQUENTIAL SCRIPT!! Used to determine if a sequential script should advance to the next action. This allows for short circuiting the current object/team idle check. Note that this cannot be the first action of a sequential script.

UIString.value: conditions are true advance to next action in this sequential script

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Player/Set Player to a Class
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Use this to set a player to a particular class type

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Player/Set Player respawns to #
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Use this to set the number of times a player can respawn/redeploy

ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: The value of the counter will be used as a percentage (10 is 10%), and values over 100 will increase the object's total health

UIString.value: health is set to percentage in

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Player/Build/Set Player Build Time Multiplier
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: The multiplier is used to scale the build time of all of the player's units

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Player/Build/Unlock a entitlement object to the player
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: The player can be granted access to object which is by default unlockable only by a higher level

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Scripting/Reference/Set Reference to player spellbook.
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Set an object reference to the player spellbook (Used in CnC 4 for the production queue.)

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Scripting/Counters/Set counter to objects under production on named object by kindof
Scripting/Counters/Set counter to objects owned by player of kindof
Player/Build/Player builds object instantly on named object
Object Type/Settings/Set the Max health of the unit (in percentage).
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Sets the maximum health of a unit(as a percentage) to the value specified and optionally sets the units current health to this value as well. (Note if setting the max health lower than the current health the current health will automatically be set to max.

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Object Type/Add Fx onto Named Object
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Use this script to play a FXList on an objects location. Note that this can bring down performance and please be very cautious in using this script.(no funky for loop calls on each object)

ScriptActionTemplate.UIName: Object Type/Named object captures a upgrade crystal
ScriptActionTemplate.HelpText: Use this script to command an object to capture the upgrade crystal.
